data.explanation: It could result in denial of service (DoS) attacks.
data.incorrect_answers: ['  The user would not have to wait too long to have her password reset.','  The network administrator would have to reset the account manually.','  It could decrease calls to the help desk.']
data.answer1: It could result in denial of service (DoS) attacks.
data.answer2: The user would not have to wait too long to have her password reset.
data.answer3: The network administrator would have to reset the account manually.
data.answer4: It could decrease calls to the help desk.

data.incorrect_answers__002: A formal procedure should be in place for disabling accounts for employees who are dismissed, resign, or retire from the organization.

data.incorrect_answers: ['  Access should be ended as soon as the employee is no longer part of the organization.','  A formal procedure should be in place for disabling accounts for employees who are dismissed, resign, or retire from the organization.','  Logs should be monitored because current employees are sometimes tempted to use an older dormant account instead of their own account.']
data.answer1: All orphaned and dormant accounts should be deleted immediately whenever they are discovered.
data.answer2: Access should be ended as soon as the employee is no longer part of the organization.
data.answer3: A formal procedure should be in place for disabling accounts for employees who are dismissed, resign, or retire from the organization.
data.answer4: Logs should be monitored because current employees are sometimes tempted to use an older dormant account instead of their own account.

data.answer2: A user who receives multiple hoaxes could contact his supervisor for help.
data.answer3: By sending out a hoax, an attacker can convince a user to read his email more often.
data.answer4: Hoaxes are not used by attackers today.

data.question: At a staff meeting one of the technicians suggested that the enterprise protect its new web server by hiding it and not telling anyone where it is located. Iosif raised his hand and said that security through obscurity was a poor idea. Why did he say that?
data.correct_answer: It would be essentially impossible to keep its location a secret from everyone.
data.incorrect_answers__001: It is an unproven approach and has never been tested.
data.incorrect_answers__002: It depends too heavily upon non-repudiation in order for it to succeed.
data.incorrect_answers__003: It would be too costly to have one isolated server by itself.
data.explanation: It would be essentially impossible to keep its location a secret from everyone.
data.incorrect_answers: ['It is an unproven approach and has never been tested.','It depends too heavily upon non-repudiation in order for it to succeed.','It would be too costly to have one isolated server by itself.']
data.answer1: It would be essentially impossible to keep its location a secret from everyone.
data.answer2: It is an unproven approach and has never been tested.
data.answer3: It depends too heavily upon non-repudiation in order for it to succeed.
data.answer4: It would be too costly to have one isolated server by itself.

data.question: What common method is used to ensure the security and integrity of a root CA?

data.incorrect_answers: ['Keep it in an online state and encrypt it.','Only use the root CA infrequently.','Password protect the root CA']
data.answer1: Keep it in an offline state from the network.
data.answer2: Keep it in an online state and encrypt it.
data.answer3: Only use the root CA infrequently.

data.answer2: These targets have notoriously weak security and are easy to penetrate.
data.answer3: The targets are privately owned and cannot afford high levels of security.
